Notes on recent experiments, 3042-3
A strange-looking symbol, probably mystical.
A rune or glyph of some unknown type.
A mystical symbol, possibly inactive.
What's wrong with all these mirrors?
A very odd painting.
The bridge is closed for now.
The Council is in the opposite direction.
There's trouble on the road. Please remain in town for now.
Please stay in the high town for now.
Clear skies, citizens!
We'll talk after your swearing-in.
I'll be with you in a minute.
Let's get you deputized, first, shall we?
I'm in the middle of something - sorry!
Lord Carran said not to bother you… yet.
Come back later. I'm busy with the accounts.
Lord Carran said no more beer… sorry!
I'm busy. Come back later.
Oh, it's you. Well, I'm still busy. Thank you for your service.
Look who's here - Caer Cyflen's rising stars!
Council business is not my business. Be on your way.
We knew this war was looming. We'll prevail, as always.
Go get killed in the Badlands…
You were still filling your diapers when I killed my first ghoul…
I heard your stories. Not impressive.
I know everyone in this city… and everyone knows me.
You're still here? I'm sure there are some rats to kill in some cave somewhere.
I know that look. Something happened… something bad.
Don't get too cocky. These Soraks have more tricks up their sleeves.
That crown's a trouble magnet, I can tell.
Still alive? Good. There's more cleaning up to do.
I'm better, sure. Doesn't mean I can't have a couple of beers…
Well, I handled some unfinished business… feels good. I'm celebrating.
If you're looking for a sharp blade… I'm your man.
Any time, friends… I mean, any time after I finish this beer.
I'm busy. Go see Galar.
We're packing - sorry!
You want to buy something, ask Galar.
No time to chat - sorry!
Keep out, strangers!
The Baron's waiting for you.
Stay in the light, citizens!
This door is blocked… magically?
Something's off.
We should search the area carefully.
Look at this place!
Doesn't make any sense…
Where did those goblins come from?
Some hole in the mountain, I guess.
What's that smell?
Damn, it stinks…
I wouldn't sleep here.
The Soraks can't be far away.
We need to rest if we want to stand a chance against them.
This place is so dark…
That was fun.
That was a long shot.
We were so close.
I can't believe Lisbath stayed behind…
We're all gonna die…
I'll have to tell the captain's wife.
We should have left long ago…
Leadership is what we need now.
They won't get me without a fight.
Up to my knees in the mud, nothing new here.
Shit food, shit shoes, business as usual.
If we survive this I might drink myself to death.
This place doesn't make any sense.
In the Badlands… blah, blah…
What happens if you fall down there?
Wanna try?
All these books floating around and I can't grab them.
Are those webs?
Welcome, deputies!
Your rooms are ready.
Good day, senior deputies.
Clear skies… as they say!
This place is so… wet.
Feels like everything's dead around here…
Well, it's dark, but at least it's not sewers anymore.
Stay on your guard! We weren't invited here.
What's in all those bottles?
I wouldn't set them on fire just to find out.
Smells like death.
Is that a… pile of corpses? Gross!
Someone here doesn't like the light of day.
What kind of castle is that?
Someone transformed it into a maze.
Someone paranoid, you mean?
We're going to die here.
There must a way be out.
Look for hints!
It lost its mana, that's all.
These arrows, they're not just random.
Something's changed here.
That cannot be opened from here.
There must be a mechanism somewhere.
I heard a mechanism.
That opened something.
This guy made it this far… maybe he found a hint.
Another victim of the maze…
Tell me we're not going back in there…
So, no rune activated on that teleporter.
I guess we need to reset the teleporter.
I think we took a wrong turn.
Hmm… four slabs for the four of us?
And… no rune on that teleporter, either.
I think this slab has triggered something!
I heard some kind of mechanism!
Keep away from my home, strangers!
Where's that damn femur?
She's crazy…
Shouldn't we go to Coparann?
My beautiful river… broken and stained…
The pull, the pull…
Master, I'm coming!
Are there dwarf kings now? Halfling kings too, maybe?
That sounds… wrong.
No slaves, no Gates…
…this travel is exhausting.
Humans don't look that bad.
They smell a bit, though…
This… town is really dirty.
Is this Baron really a dwarf?
I can't call a dwarf my lord, can I?
He's rude. But he is a dwarf, after all.
He is a nice dwarf.
A halfling merchant? I almost didn't see him.
Nice gardens.
This place is magnificent.
I never thought I'd get so close to the embassies.
That's a view!
Before the Cataclysm, there were no gods on Solasta.
No humans, either.
Then the Rift opened.
Some say it was a magical accident…
…or the work of an evil god.
No one knows for sure.
The Cataclysm destroyed the old High Elf empire
- Manacalon, they called it -
and twisted the land beyond recognition.
Now, only the brave and the foolish go there, in search of ancient treasures.
But something is happening, deep in those Badlands.
Whatever it is,
it can't be good.
Entering Telema
So, these are the ruins of Telema?
Just as the chronicles describe them!
Imagine the wonders that await us inside!
Don't forget… we're here to help the Scavengers.
And get rich, right?
Help the Scavengers and get rich.
You're all heart, aren't you?
That must be their camp over there.
Come on, let's go.
The Scavengers' Camp
Who goes there?
Friends!
Runnel sent us.
Where is he?
Resting… he was in pretty bad shape, but he'll be okay.
He said you need help.
We did. If only you'd come sooner…
What happened?
We came as soon as we could. What happened?
We know… and thanks.
Dek here is upset, that's all.
I can speak for myself, thank you!
He thinks we should have left with Runnel.
Instead of waiting here for the orcs to kill us?
Absolutely, I think we should have left!
We're here now.
Well, we're here now. How can we help?
Never mind Dek.
He's upset, that's all.
I can speak for myself, thank you!
He thinks we should have left with Runnel.
Instead of waiting for the orcs to kill us?
Absolutely, I think we should have left!
We could go back.
Well, if we're too late, maybe we should just go back.
Yes, well, maybe you should!
Never mind Dek.
He's upset, that's all.
Upset? Why should I be upset? We're just waiting to die, that's all!
We can't leave Hector in there.
He's dead, Lena… dead! It's too late!
You don't know that!
Calm down.
Calm down, now. This won't help.
We'll help you.
It's all right… we're here to help you.
Amazing.
Why don't you just kill each other and save the orcs the trouble?
What's our help worth to you, anyway?
Stop it!
All right.
What did Runnel tell you?
Just that his team needed help… nothing else.
We were scavenging in the ruins, and -
Orcs! There's a whole tribe in there!
It was just a raiding party.
We fought them off…
…but they killed some of our people and dragged Hector off.
And we've just been waiting here for them to come and finish the job.
They haven't done that yet, though.
Well, you're right about your friend…
…he must be dead by now.
We don't know that. There is always hope.
Hope? Those orcs had him for dinner the first night.
I don't know… they took him alive, after all…
So they wanted to keep him fresh… orcs are orcs!
Ignore them. So, we just need to go in and find Hector?
Yeah… good luck with that!
Why is he so angry?
He and Hector don't exactly get along.
But he's one of our crew…
…and I won't leave anyone behind.
We gave our word to your leaders.
We will get Hector back.
Thanks.
Do you need food?
You think we'll be away for that long?
You can never be too careful…
…that's the law of the Badlands.
We can spare some if you need it.
We have more than we need for just the two of us.
Are you serious?
You're giving away our food?
They're risking their lives for us, Dek.
For Hector. We can starve, apparently.
The rescuers get the food.
The rescuers get the food.
Get it?
I don't believe it.
That's on you, Lena.
Don't worry,
that's just the way he is.
Thanks, Lena.
No.
Nice try.
Shut up.
We should get moving and find your friend.
Thanks!
And good luck!
You're right… keep your food.
You're right… keep it. We'll survive.
We'll be back in no time.
If not, you'll have enough to eat.
Don't look at me.
Just one day of food, Dek.
All right, take the damn food!
Thank you!
Absolutely.
Your boss said you'd feed us.
Your boss said we could take whatever resources we needed.
Did he?
Are you calling me a liar?
No.
So?
So take the damn food!
Why not?
Fair enough.
Impressive negotiation skills.
He's stubborn, that's all.
A Sight for Sore Eyes
Look at that!
Perfectly preserved!
What is it?
It's a scene from the Imperial conquest of the northern provinces.
When the Empire ruled the lands of the Snow Alliance.
I can't pretend to feel nostalgic about those times.
Nostalgic? That was more than a thousand years ago!
The Old Empire was built on slavery and racism.
Thanks for the (yawn) history lesson.
Now… does this look valuable to you?
All history is valuable, my friend.
Tell that to my purse.
Anyway, this doesn't help Hector, so let's move out.
Too Good to Be True
Well, that's interesting.
You don't say! Look at that!
I'd be careful if I were you.
It looks too good to be true.
That's right. You can't be too careful…
…that's the law of the Badlands.
Memory of the Past
Try not to stare… you're making that statue uncomfortable.
But it's… can you read this?
Never had the benefit of an Imperial indoctrin… I mean, education.
That's Emperor Gildean the Third.
How do you know?
It's written here.
For those who can read it.
That's nice for you, I'm sure.
His was a very ancient dynasty.
Look at his date of birth.
And location.
Wait! I must copy this.
The Tower will find this interesting.
Are you done?
Dead End?
Can we open it?
I don't see how.
Must be magically sealed.
Do you think a magic seal from Imperial times would still work?
In the Badlands, anything's possible.
Do you have a spell to open it?
No.
Let's not waste time, then. Move out!
They must have gone through here after they took Hector.
Really? We need to crawl through there?
Yeah, but you don't mind being on your knees, do you?
Very funny.
I see light ahead!
Let me take a look before you go clanking around in your armor.
Be careful!
Law of the Badlands, my friend.
Meeting the Locals
The orcs are here.
Looks like we can sneak around.
Even me?
Ehh… probably.
Did you see Hector?
Not a trace.
We should attack… we have the element of surprise.
But what if Hector's down there too?
I hear some orc tribes can be bartered with.
Not these orcs.
Disappointment…
So, no Hector?
It doesn't make any sense.
Maybe he's farther down.
All right, let's keep looking.
Lighting the Darkness
I don't like this.
We can climb down.
It's too dark.
Too unstable, too. These blocks look like they could fall at any minute.
There's some kind of black oil dripping from the ceiling.
Maybe we can use it to light up the place.
No Way Back
Damn it! Now we're stuck!
Do you think the orcs would bring Hector farther in than this?
Not the orcs, no…
…but something else… maybe.
We've come this far… let's find him.
I'm starting to think we might need that food after all.
Unexpected Denizens
What is this… an amphitheater?
A very special one.
Not room for much of a crowd…
Students of magic. The Masters taught spells here.
Do spiders like magic shows?
Because I see a lot of webs.
Deep spiders. We will have to be careful.
Deep Spiders?
Very large and aggressive, but sensitive to light.
Just how large is very large?
Just keep your lights ready…
…and your oil handy.
The more light we have, the fewer spiders we'll face.
We don't have a choice here. The only way out is up.
A Way Out?
How many are there?
You don't want to know.
Try pushing this down!
I feel a weakness here.
Escape… to Hector!
Well done!
You sure they're dead?
Well, they're not coming back.
Good.
My friends, I believe I have found Hector.
By all the gods at once… thank you!
Are you Hector?
Yes! And you?
The boss sent us. Runnel went for help.
Runnel! So he survived?
Barely, but yes.
He's safely back in town.
So, did the spiders take you?
The orcs did, after their raid.
They kept me for a while.
I was wondering why.
I finally got the answer when they…
…well, they sacrificed me.
What?
They feed the spiders. So they don't get eaten themselves.
They leave captives at the top of the amphitheater.
Oh, that one?
We kind of… destroyed it.
The spider nest, too.
Interesting.
I'm not sure how the orcs will react to that.
This spider cult seemed important to them.
Can't say I feel sorry for them.
I owe you my life. Thanks again.
You are most welcome.
You should rest, and I think we should do the same.
Good idea.
What's your story?
So Hector, what's your story?
Me? I'm just another Scavenger, really.
I make a living bringing old stuff out of the Badlands.
What about Lena and Dek?
Do you know Lena and Dek? They seem like quite a pair!
Oh, those two… always fighting over something.
But you couldn't separate them if you wanted to.
They seemed pretty much at each other's throats.
Yeah, like I said… always fighting.
But in battle, always back to back.
Aww… that's so sweet.
Did you find anything good in here?
Did you find anything good in the ruins?
No, not much. You've seen the state of the place…
…but there was something.
Didn't have time to use it.
What is it?
A key?
I think it opens the door in the ruins.
Oh, yeah… that door.
At least, I hope it does.
Not much else, though. I think the orcs got it all.
You're a cleric of Einar?
You're wearing the flaming sword.
And I can see you're from the Order of the Beacon.
Are you a priest, Hector?
Just a humble follower.
This was given to me by one of your brothers.
We fought together… he felt like he owed me.
And he gave me this.
I think we're all ready to go.
Indeed.
I think we're close to the surface.
I can feel it.
All right… let's move.
Orcs! Over there!
It's an ambush!
Time to fight!
Hey! Take a look at this.
The stone is carved.
Are we back near the ruins?
It looks fragile, let's try pushing it.
Well done… we're back in the ruins!
So, do you still have that key?
Sure.
Take it.
Amazing!
This room hasn't been opened in a millennium!
Those books are falling to pieces.
Not this one!
Look around for other valuables.
Already doing it!
Hey! Here they are!
I'll be damned… they're alive!
We told you we'd find him.
Hector?
Lena, wait!
What's going on?
That's not Hector!
What?
Then just who are you, friend?
Put down your weapons.
Why would we do that?
This beer tastes like donkey piss. Not that I'm complaining.
Hope I'm not too late.
Ran into a bit of trouble on the way here.
Take the load off. There's plenty of donkey piss to go around.
Sit. Relax. Perhaps you'd enjoy a pint of this obnoxious ale?
Here for the Council job? Join the club.
If you're here for the Council job, get in line.
You're not too late, friend. We're all here for the same reason.
Apparently, Lord Carran likes to keep people waiting.
Though if this Lord Carran doesn't show up soon, I may go looking for him.
Grab a chair.
Another round, barkeeper. Four of your finest flagons of donkey piss, please!
Looks like you've been waiting here a while.
I see you're all making the best of this.
So is this the job? Getting shitfaced?
We do what we have to. So what's this trouble you were telling us about?
Indeed. You mentioned something about some trouble. Would you care to elaborate?
Well, I was making my way here…
…when three bandits leapt out of the bushes with crossbows.
They dragged me off to some decrepit prison…
…and tossed me in a filthy cell that smelled of rat piss.
Well, I was heading down a lonely road…
…when three shitheads jumped from the bushes, dragged me off…
…and threw my ass in this rundown jail.
Smelled like some poor bastard had died in there.
I was heading down the highway, minding my own business…
…when three brigands burst out of the bushes and waylaid me.
They carried me off to some ramshackle prison.
An Imperial ruin of some sort…
Fortunately, the walls were as weak as this mediocre ale we're drinking.
…Don't know what was holding the place up…
…a strong wind coulda taken it down.
Nice move, that trick with the wall. Glad you're no worse for wear.
So you escaped unscathed. Well done, my friend!
My flagon is empty of ale, and Lord Carran still isn't here.
Perhaps someone else can tell a story since it looks like we might be here a while.
This Council needs to get organized. They have no right to keep us waiting like this.
Have another ale. It's not like you have anywhere better to be.
I don't mind waiting as long as they pay us for our darned time.
The Council is likely busy with important matters of state, and we are not, so have patience.
You think the Council cares about the likes of us? They'll get to us when they're good and ready.
Well, let me tell you my story then. I, too, was accosted on the way here, but I faced my foes head on.
I have a tale to tell as well. I, too, was attacked, but I put an end to my enemies with blood and pain.
So what are you waiting for? Spit it out, why don't you?
Let's hear it, then. Don't be shy.
Proceed, then. Everyone enjoys a tale well told.
What a bunch namby-pambies! You're lucky you weren't attacked by Soraks!
I don't remember anyone asking your opinion.
Shut your mouth, or I'll shut it for ya!
That's right, buddy. It's always good to be lucky.
The Badlands are thick with 'em. Shapeshifting bastards!
Never mind him. He's just another drunk Scavenger.
Everyone's a critic.
I'm so tired of stupid drunks ranting about mythical creatures.
Aren't all drunks basically stupid?
Soraks might be legend, but orcs are quite real, and not just in the Badlands.
…I stumbled across a secret settlement right here in the Principality.
What?
Bullshit!
That is preposterous.
High in the hills, two days west of here.
I left the main road to find a shorter way through…
And I was making good time…
…when I dropped through a frickin' sinkhole into a cave.
I was dragging my weary ass up the hills west of here…
…and decided to leave the road to look for a shortcut.
It was beautiful day. Blue skies. Birds singing. I watched one take wing…
…and fell right into a blasted hole.
I traveled here from the east, and left the main highway…
…hoping to save time by traversing the hills.
The views were magnificent, but I should have kept my eye on the path.
Because it gave way beneath my feet, plunging me into gloomy darkness.
Not sure I would have slept so close to a horde of orcs.
I would have slaughtered every one of those green-skinned monsters.
You slept with a bunch of orcs? That explains the smell.
Orcs have a very distinctive stink.
I'm beginning to think Lord Carran might be a mythical creature.
If Lord Carran keeps us waiting much longer, I might greet him with a dagger.
We should bill the Council for all this wasted time.
We've all told a tale of our travels here. All but one of us.
Yes, but I have a good reason for that. It's none of your damn business.
Come on, now. Don't be a killjoy. We all sang for our supper. Now it's your turn!
We can't take up arms together if we don't trust each other.
You can't have a true friendship without trust. What are you hiding?
Fine - you want to know the truth?
I stopped on the way here to visit an old friend of mine…
And discovered he was up to his eyeballs in debt with a loan shark.
Oh, that's not good.
Sounds like an idiot.
So he was in dire straits?
Indeed. He put up a family heirloom as collateral and wanted me to reacquire it.
Because, you see, I can be quite stealthy when necessary.
Are you four here to see Lord Carran?
We're not here to get drunk.
Who's asking?
Maybe we're here looking for a fight.
Well, we're not here to drink ourselves to death.
Depends on who's asking.
Maybe. Or maybe we're here just to raise hell and break heads.
Well, thank you for making that clear…
A fight, is it? I'm sure we can find an outlet for your… enthusiasm.
Well, if you are here for Lord Carran of the Legacy Council, that would be me.
So you're real, then?
We're ready.
We should get paid for waiting.
So you're not a mythical creature after all.
Then we are here at your service, sir.
Fine. I'd like to present you with a bill for the time we just spent cooling our heels.
Unlike, say, a sober adventurer?
Very good.
Feel free. The Council's bursary enjoys a good laugh.
Might we ask a bit more about this quest of yours, sir, if you please?
Can you tell us more about the job?
We kinda need a little bit more info 'bout the job, milord.
Well, I suppose it's better if you know what you're doing.
What do you want to know?
About the Legacy Council.
About the Principality.
Are you our employer?
We're good, thank you.
We should be going, don't you think?
What can you tell us about this place, the Principality?
We don't exactly have the time…
…anyway. The Principality of Masgarth is ruled by Princess Ceiwad Silverflower.
We are a wealthy state, with fertile lands, and the easiest access to the Badlands…
…through a pass called the Copperhead Road.
We're in the capital, Caer Cyflen, which was once part of the ancient Manacalon Empire of the high elves.
Hence the magnificent elvish buildings up there in the high town.
While we don't have a state religion, all of the major faiths on Solasta are represented here…
…though we tend to favor Einar, the god of valor and fidelity.
Are we going to work for you?
Not exactly, no. I'll be your contact with the Legacy Council, which you will serve as deputies.
That's why we need to go there and get you sworn in.
We hear this is a mission for the Council, but what is it, exactly?
Dear Maraike! You don't know?
I'll try to make it simple, but you know - politics…
The Council includes representatives of the most powerful and influential organizations in the Eastern Kingdoms.
It was created to lead a joint effort to explore the Badlands.
What are the Badlands?
What are the Badlands, really?
Simply put, they are a monster-ridden, chaotic wasteland that used to be the elven empire called Manacalon.
It was destroyed about a thousand years ago by the great Cataclysm.
Now, only ruins remain, full of forgotten knowledge, riches, and dangers.
What are the Eastern Kingdoms?
Which countries make up these Eastern Kingdoms?
Simple. The Principality of Masgarth, here, is in the center.
The Snow Alliance lies to the north.
The Kingdom of Gallivan, to the east.
And the New Empire, to the south.
All friendly, more or less, but the peace is fragile.
What organizations are there?
What are the organizations you mentioned?
The Council is… how to put it? A non-governmental organization.
Meaning that state governments are not represented, to avoid partisanship.
Instead, there are delegates from the Guild of Antiquarians, the Tower of Knowledge, the Arcaneum, and the Circle of Danantar.
And the Church of Einar guarantees fairness, led by Marshal Beric Sunblaze and Oathkeeper Leira Kean.
We know enough.
I think we know enough now. Thank you!
Very well.
Come! Gather your things. You're late for your swearing in.
Whose fault is that?
Hurry up and wait. The story of my life.
I, for one, am very curious to see the inside of that Council room.
Liam… always thoughtful.
There you are, you filthy crook!
You? What…? You're drunk! Get out of here before I kill you!
Think you scare me? Not anymore!
A grave mistake.
Ow! I must have fallen on my wrong side…
Ow! That's going to leave a mark.
Damn! That hurt like hell.
Orcs, here? Strange. I wonder what this totem means.
Just my luck, falling right into an orc hideout!
Orcs? Of course, that explains the smell…
My word, this is an orc hideout! The malodor is unmistakable.
Orcs? Clearly I'm being punished for leaving the road. Now to seek redemption.
Orcs, here? I must report this… which means, I must get out of here alive.
Damn me, like I needed to fall into an orc shithole!
An orc hideout right in the middle of the Principality… how surprising. Let's hope they've eaten recently.
What the… ? Whatever this is, it's not good.
What a peculiar style of art… clearly the work of some savage hand.
Charming, that. Just as long as my head doesn't end up on the top.
There they are…
…if they see me, I'm dead.
…discretion is clearly the better part of valor in this instance.
…head down, or I'm next on the menu.
What's worse, it looks like this is the only way out.
No other means of egress is apparent.
They're camped right by the only exit? It just keeps getting better!
I just need to be patient. They can't stay there forever.
Fine, then, I shall wait until they go. These creatures do hunt, right?
Guess I'm waiting them out. At least these rocks are… damned uncomfortable.
Look at this size of this Council hall!
A very impressive edifice indeed.
So this is what they spend our taxes on.
Look! Is that…
The Princess!
Wait… is she leaving?
Apparently so…
Then who will administer the oath?
The maid who empties her chamber pot?
We're too low for her.
It's not her role.
The maid who empties her chamber pot? No, we're not as important as that. Perhaps her stable boy.
A lady like her wants nothing to do with drudges like us.
There's an Oathkeeper for that, I think.
You thought it would be the Princess?
She doesn't rule the Council?
If not her, then who?
Doesn't she lead the Council?
No, in this chamber, she's just another delegate.
If she rules the whole Principality, who's more important?
Lady Kean, the Council's Oathkeeper, is trusted by all.
Lord Carran!
Yes, m'lady!
Are these your new deputies?
They are, m'lady.
Very well. Pay attention. All of you.
